page.title: 09OLDLANDS, ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: We went down a muddy bridleway behind the Duddleswell Tearooms. It was steep in some parts and we slipped. At the bottom there was a shallow stream. We walked through it though there was a bridge; then we saw some rare flowers called 'Spotted Orchids'. A while after that we saw two cottages named 'Brown's Brook' and 'Primrose Patch'. We found a little patch with charcoal in it and then there was another stream. We jumped over it because it had quicksand at the bottom and it was deeper than it looked. We saw birch, willow and lots of sapling oaks. There was a fair amount of broom and bracken. We went back a different way and that was muddy too. Then we went back in the mini-bus passing Oldlands Hall.
